tags.name: atomic
tags.doc:
Makes the enclosed block [i]atomic[/i].

An atomic block works much like [tag db]transaction[/tag], but uses the databases SAVEPOINT feature to better handle nested atomic blocks.
tags.synopsis: mark a block as being atomic
tags.example:
<!--- taken from Moya Social Links -->
        <db:atomic>
            <db:get model="#Link" let:id="link" dst="link" />
            <db:get model="#Vote" let:link="link" dst="vote" />
            <db:create if="not vote"
                model="#Vote" let:link="link" let:user=".user" let:score="score" dst="vote" />
            <let link.score="link.score - vote.score" vote.score="score" />
            <let link.score="link.score + vote.score" />
        </db:atomic>

tags.name: big-integer
tags.doc: Defines a [i]big integer[/i] field. Must appear within a <model> tag.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a big integer

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: boolean
tags.doc: Defines a [i]boolean[/i] field. Must appear within a <model> tag.
tags.synopsis: a field that is True or False

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: bulk-create
tags.doc: Create database object in bulk via JSON. Useful for quickly adding fixture data.
tags.synopsis: bulk create database objects

tags.name: check
tags.doc: Check connection to DB, throw db.no-connection if connection failed. This tag is used by Moya Debug, it is unlikely to be generally useful.
tags.synopsis: check connection to the database

tags.name: commit
tags.doc:
Commit any pending transaction. This will [i]flush[/i] db operations to the database. If you have create new objects and you want to know their [i]primary key[/i] (id), you will need to commit them to the database.

Note, that if this tag is called from within a [tag db]transaction[/tag] tag, nothing will be committed until the end of the [tag db]transaction[/tag].
tags.synopsis: commit the current transaction

tags.name: create
tags.doc: Create new object in the database.
tags.synopsis: create an object in the database
tags.example:
<db:create model="#User"
                let:username="username"
                let:email="email"
                let:first_name="first_name"
                let:last_name="last_name"
                let:password="password"
                dst="newuser" />

tags.name: date
tags.doc: Defines a [i]date[/i] field.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a date

auto.name: auto
auto.doc: Set to current time when created

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: datetime
tags.doc: Defines a [i]datetime[/i] field.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a date and time

auto.name: auto
auto.doc: Set to current time when created

tags.example: <datetime name="last_login" label="Date of last login" null="yes" />

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: decimal
tags.doc: Defines a fixed precision number field in a <model>. Use this field element for currency.
tags.synopsis: a fix precision number

scale.name: scale
scale.doc: number of digits after the decimal point

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: delete
tags.doc: Delete an object from the database.
tags.synopsis: delete from the database

tags.name: delete-all
tags.doc: Delete every object from a table
tags.synopsis: delete all objects in a table

tags.name: float
tags.doc: Defines a [i]floating point[/i] field. Must appear within a <model> tag.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a floating point number

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: foreign-key
tags.doc:
Add a [i]foreign key[/i] to a model. A foreign key is a reference to another table.

    A [tag]foreign-key[/tag] tag must appear within a [tag]model[/tag] tag.
tags.synopsis: a key to another model

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

default.name: default
default.doc: Default value if not set explicitly

owned.name: owned
owned.doc: Is tis model owned by the referenced model?

blank.name: blank
blank.doc: Allow empty field in Moya admin?

owner.name: owner
owner.doc: Does this model own the referenced object?

options.name: options
options.doc: Objects to consider in admin forms

name.name: name
name.doc: Name of the foreign key in the model

tags.example:
<!-- foreign key to a User model, called "user", must not be NULL -->
        <foreign-key model="#User" name="user" null="no"/>

tags.name: generic-key
tags.doc: Create a [i]generic[/i] key. A generic key is [tag db]foreign-key[/tag], but can link to any database object.
tags.synopsis: a generic foreign key

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: get
tags.doc: Get an object from the database.
tags.synopsis: get an object in the database.

tags.name: get-column
tags.doc: Get a specific column from the database. This is required if you don't know the column reference ahead of time, i.e. when you want to generate a query dynamically from a table. Moya Admin uses this tag, but it unlikely to be useful for general applications.
tags.synopsis: get a column from a model

tags.name: get-exist
tags.doc: Gets an object from the db, or throws a [c]moya.db.does-not-exist[/c] exception if it doesn't exist
tags.synopsis: get an object in the database.

tags.name: get-one
tags.doc: Like [tag db]get[/tag], but will throw a [c]db.multiple-results[/c] if there are more than one result, or [c]db.no-result[/c] if there are no results.
tags.synopsis: get precisely one matching object

tags.name: get-or-create
tags.doc:
Get an object from the db if it exists, create it if it doesn't.

If the object is create, the code in the enclosed block is executed.
tags.synopsis: get an object from the database, or create it if it doesn't exist.
tags.example:
<db:get-or-create model="#Permission" let:name="'admin'"
                let:description="'User may perform administration tasks'">
                <echo>New permission was created.
            </db:get-or-create>

tags.name: get-required
tags.doc: Gets an object from the db. If the object is not present in the db then return a 404 (not found) response. This is useful when page content corresponds to a single object in the database.
tags.synopsis: get an object from the database, or return a 404 if it doesn't exist

tags.name: if-exists
tags.doc: Execute the enclosed block if a object exists in the db.
tags.synopsis: execute a block if an object exists in the database
tags.example:
<db:if-exists model="#Link" let:topic="topic" let:slug="slug" >
                <forms:error>Slug exists, please edit the title</forms:error>
                <break/>
            </db:if-exists>

tags.name: if-not-exists
tags.doc: Executes the enclosed block if an object does not exists in the db.
tags.synopsis: executes a block of code if an object does not exist in the db

tags.name: inspect
tags.doc: Inspect a DB model, so you can view column information. Used by Moya Admin.
tags.synopsis: get model information

tags.name: integer
tags.doc: Defines an [i]integer[/i] field. Must appear within a <model> tag.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores an integer

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: many-to-many
tags.synopsis: define a many to may relationship

picker.name: picker
picker.doc: Admin table to use as a picker control

lazy.name: lazy
lazy.doc: Specifies how related items should be loaded

backlabel.name: backlabel
backlabel.doc: Short description of backref purpose, if used

search.name: search
search.doc: DB query referencing search field q

backpicker.name: backpicker
backpicker.doc: Admin table to use as a picker control for the other side of the relationship

options.name: options
options.doc: Objects to consider in admin forms

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

tags.name: model
tags.doc:
Defines a database [i]model[/i], which maps data stored in a database table on to Moya objects.

Models are referenced by their [i]libname[/i] in database expressions, the [c]name[/c] attribute is used when creating tables. If you convert a model instance to a string, it will return the value of the [c]repr[/c] attribute, with substitutions made with the object context.
tags.synopsis: define a database model

name.name: name
name.doc: Name of the model (used internally by the db)

db.name: db
db.doc: Database to use (default will use the default database)

repr.name: repr
repr.doc: Text representation of a model instance (substitution will use the model as a data context)

tags.example:
<model name="Permission" libname="Permission" xmlns="http://moyaproject.com/db"
            repr="Permission '${name}' ${description}">
            <string name="name" required="yes" null="no" blank="no" length="30" unique="yes"/>
            <text name="description" null="no" default=""/>
        </model>

tags.name: new-query
tags.doc: Create a query object dynamically.
tags.synopsis: dynamically create a database query

tags.name: one-to-one
tags.doc:
A [i]one to one[/i] is a foreign key, that create a single reference to the other model.
This is reflected in the remote side which has a reference to the linked object, rather than a collection.
tags.synopsis: create a one to one relationship

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

default.name: default
default.doc: Default value if not set explicitly

owned.name: owned
owned.doc: Is tis model owned by the referenced model?

blank.name: blank
blank.doc: Allow empty field in Moya admin?

owner.name: owner
owner.doc: Does this model own the referenced object?

options.name: options
options.doc: Objects to consider in admin forms

name.name: name
name.doc: Name of the foreign key in the model

tags.name: property
tags.doc: Add a property to a db object
tags.synopsis: add a property to a database object

tags.name: query
tags.doc: Query the database. Will return a query set object that may be iterated over by default, unless [c]'collect'[/c] is specified.
tags.synopsis: query the database

flat.name: flat
flat.doc: Flatten results in to a list?

src.name: src
src.doc: Source query, if further query operations are required

distinct.name: distinct
distinct.doc: Make query distinct (remove duplicates from results)?

collectkey.name: collectkey
collectkey.doc: Collect key if collect is True

maxresults.name: maxresults
maxresults.doc: Maximum number of items to return

columns.name: columns
columns.doc: Columns to return, if model is not specified

tags.example:
<!-- examples taken from Moya apps -->

        <!-- Get a month worth of posts -->
        <db:query model="#Post" dst="posts" orderby="-published_date"
            filter="#Post.published_date gte start and #Post.published_date lt start.next_month"/>

        <!-- delete a user session -->
        <db:query model="#Session" let:session_key=".request.cookies.authsession" action="delete"/>

        <!-- get promoted topics in Moya Social Links -->
        <db:query model="#Topic" filter="#Topic.promoted == yes" orderby="#Topic.title" dst="promoted_topics"/>

tags.name: relationship
tags.doc: Defines a relationship between two tables.
tags.synopsis: define a model relationship that creates a collection

search.name: search
search.doc: DB query referencing search field q

tags.name: roll-back
tags.doc: This tag will rollback a transaction, and restore the database to the state where it was previously commited.
tags.synopsis: roll back the current transactions

tags.name: small-integer
tags.doc: Defines a [i]small integer[/i] field. Must appear within a <model> tag.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a small integer

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: sort
tags.doc: Sort a Query Set
tags.synopsis: sort a query set

src.name: src
src.doc: Source query, if further query operations are required

tags.name: sort-map
tags.doc:
Sort a query set in one of a number of different ways.

This is typically used to sort a table of results based on a value in the query set.
tags.synopsis: sort a query set dynamically
tags.example:
<db:sort-map src="characters" sort=".request.GET.sort" reverse=".request.GET.order=='desc'">
            <str dst="name">#Character.name</str>
            <str dst="species">#Character.species</str>
            <str dst="age">#Character.age</str>
        </db:sort-map>

tags.name: sql
tags.doc:
This tag executes raw SQL and returns a [i]results[/i] object.

Results objects have the properties [c]rowcount[/c] (number of rows matched), [c]rowkeys[/c] (list of field names), and [c]fetch[/c] (an interface to retrieve results).

You can retrieve all rows with [c]results.fetch.all[/c], or a single row at a time with [c]results.fetch.one[/c]. You can get a batch of a rows by using an integer index. For example, [c]results.fetch.10[/c] retrieves the next 10 rows.

If your query returns a scalar value, you can retrieve it with [c]results.fetch.scalar[/c].
tags.synopsis: execute raw sql
tags.example:
<db:sql dst="results" let:username="'John'">
            select * from auth_user where auth_user.username=:username;
        </db:sql>
        <echo obj="results.fetch.one"/>

tags.name: string
tags.doc: Defines a [i]string[/i] field. Must appear within a <model> tag.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a string of characters

choices.name: choices
choices.doc: A reference to a choices tag

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: string-map
tags.synopsis: a field that stores a mapping of keys and strings

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: text
tags.doc: Defines a [i]text[i] field.
tags.synopsis: a field that stores arbitrary length text

markup.name: markup
markup.doc: Format of text field, used by Moya Admin to pick an editor

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.doc: Defines a [i]timezone[/i] field.

choices.name: choices

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: token
tags.doc:
A string column containing a randomly generated token. Note, that the string is not [i]guaranteed[/i] to be unique.
    If you want a unique token you will have to implement that logic independently.
tags.synopsis: create a randomly generated token in the database

characters.name: characters
characters.doc: Choice of characters to use in token (if set, this overrides other character related attributes).

size.name: size
size.doc: Number of randomly generated characters in the token (defaults to same as length)

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: transaction
tags.doc:
Executes the enclosed block in a single transaction.

    If the block executes successfully, the changes will be committed. If an exception is thrown, the changes will be rolled back.

    Note that databases related exceptions in the enclosed black won't be thrown until the end of the transaction.

    In the case of nested transactions (a transaction inside a transactions), only the outer-most transaction will actually commit the changes. For more granular control over transactions, the [tag db]atomic[/tag] tag is preferred.

2260
tags.synopsis: commit changes to the database

tags.name: unique-together
tags.synopsis: require combinations of fields to be unique

tags.name: update
tags.doc: Update a query set with database expressions. Not to be confused with [tag]{}update[/tag] in the default namespace.
tags.synopsis: update fields in a query

tags.name: upload
tags.doc: An upload field
tags.synopsis: a field to store the path of an uploaded file

getfs.name: getfs
getfs.doc: A macro to get the filesystem to use

geturl.name: geturl
geturl.doc: Macro that returns a URL for this upload

getpath.name: getpath
getpath.doc: Macro that returns a path, will be called with 'upload' and 'form'

help.name: help
help.doc: Additional help text for use in object forms

formfield.name: formfield
formfield.doc: Macro to create a form field, used in admin

tags.name: uuid
tags.doc: Create a UUID field (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier).
tags.synopsis: create a UUID in the database

nsname.name: nsname
nsname.doc: Name in namespace (if using variant 3 or 5)
